statements: SELECT * FROM ingredients;
SELECT name, calories FROM ingredients WHERE calories > 100;
SELECT id, name, protein FROM ingredients ORDER BY protein DESC;
SELECT * FROM ingredients WHERE fat < 5 AND carbohydrates > 10;
SELECT name, calories, protein FROM ingredients WHERE protein > 20 ORDER BY calories ASC;
SELECT * FROM ingredients WHERE calories > 100 ORDER BY protein DESC, carbohydrates ASC
SELECT id, name, calories FROM ingredients WHERE fat < 5 ORDER BY calories DESC
SELECT name, calories, protein FROM ingredients WHERE protein >= 10 AND fat < 3 ORDER BY name
SELECT id, carbohydrates FROM ingredients WHERE calories BETWEEN 50 AND 200 ORDER BY id
SELECT * FROM ingredients WHERE calories > 150 AND carbohydrates < 20 ORDER BY fat
SELECT * FROM ingredients WHERE calories > 100 ORDER BY name ASC
SELECT id, name, protein FROM ingredients WHERE protein >= 10 ORDER BY id DESC
SELECT id, name, total_calories FROM meal_plans WHERE total_calories < 2000 ORDER BY total_calories ASC
SELECT name, fat, carbs FROM ingredients WHERE fat > 5 AND carbs < 20 ORDER BY name DESC
SELECT id, plan_name, total_protein FROM meal_plans WHERE total_protein >= 50 ORDER BY total_protein DESC
SELECT * FROM ingredients WHERE id = 1;
SELECT name, calories, protein FROM ingredients WHERE calories > 100;
SELECT * FROM meal_plans WHERE total_calories < 2000;
SELECT plan_name, total_protein, total_fat FROM meal_plans WHERE total_fat < 50;
SELECT id, name, carbs FROM ingredients WHERE carbs > 0 ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Ingredients;
SELECT ingredient_name, calories, fats FROM Ingredients;
SELECT meal_name, meal_type FROM Meals ORDER BY meal_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM MealIngredients WHERE amount > 50;
SELECT meal_name, ingredient_name, amount FROM Meals JOIN MealIngredients ON Meals.meal_id = MealIngredients.meal_id;
SELECT * FROM Ingredients;
SELECT ingredient_name, calories FROM Ingredients WHERE calories > 100;
SELECT meal_name, meal_type FROM Meals ORDER BY meal_name DESC;

SELECT Meals.meal_name, Ingredients.ingredient_name FROM Meals JOIN MealIngredients ON Meals.meal_id = MealIngredients.meal_id JOIN Ingredients ON MealIngredients.ingredient_id = Ingredients.ingredient_id;

SELECT meal_name, SUM(calories) AS total_calories FROM Meals JOIN MealIngredients ON Meals.meal_id = MealIngredients.meal_id JOIN Ingredients ON MealIngredients.ingredient_id = Ingredients.ingredient_id GROUP BY Meals.meal_name HAVING total_calories > 500;
SELECT * FROM ingredients
SELECT name, calories, protein FROM ingredients
SELECT name, carbs FROM ingredients
SELECT * FROM recipes
SELECT id, name FROM recipes
SELECT * FROM ingredients ORDER BY name DESC, calories ASC;
SELECT name, protein FROM ingredients WHERE protein > 10 ORDER BY protein DESC;
SELECT r.name AS recipe_name, i.name AS ingredient_name, ri.quantity FROM recipes r JOIN recipe_ingredients ri ON r.id = ri.recipe_id JOIN ingredients i ON i.id = ri.ingredient_id WHERE r.id = 1;
SELECT m.name AS meal_name, m.date, r.name AS recipe_name FROM meals m LEFT JOIN recipes r ON m.id = r.id;
SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT recipe_id) AS total_recipes, AVG(quantity) AS avg_quantity FROM recipe_ingredients;
SELECT * FROM ingredients;
SELECT id, name, calories FROM ingredients WHERE protein >= 20;
SELECT name, protein, carbohydrates FROM ingredients WHERE fats < 10;
SELECT id, name FROM meals WHERE id BETWEEN 2 AND 4;
SELECT meal_id, ingredient_id, quantity FROM meal_ingredients ORDER BY meal_id DESC;
SELECT * FROM ingredients WHERE calories > 100 ORDER BY name DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT meal_id, SUM(quantity) AS total_quantity FROM meal_ingredients GROUP BY meal_id HAVING total_quantity > 10 ORDER BY total_quantity DESC;

SELECT m.name AS meal_name, i.name AS ingredient_name, mi.quantity FROM meals m JOIN meal_ingredients mi ON m.id = mi.meal_id JOIN ingredients i ON mi.ingredient_id = i.id WHERE mi.quantity >= 0.5 ORDER BY m.name, i.name;
SELECT mp.name AS meal_plan_name, COUNT(mm.meal_id) AS num_meals FROM meal_plans mp JOIN meal_plan_meals mm ON mp.id = mm.meal_plan_id GROUP BY mp.name ORDER BY num_meals DESC;

SELECT m.name AS meal_name, SUM(i.calories) AS total_calories FROM meals m JOIN meal_ingredients mi ON m.id = mi.meal_id JOIN ingredients i ON mi.ingredient_id = i.id GROUP BY m.name ORDER BY total_calories DESC LIMIT 3;
